mdRecord.dcterms:title: U.S. Army mess kit from World War II
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The mess kit was owned by 8th Evacuation U.S. Army Unit Nurse Ruth Eastman during World War II. Ruth Eastman donated the kit to the UNiversity of Virginia in 1988. The following text is etched into the inside of the mess kit: "Fetty", "170", and "Ruth Anne Eastman". The following text is stamped on the mess kit exterior: "U.S. RIA, 1919".
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: World War, 1939-1945
United States. Army. Evacuation Hospital, 8th
